title: import torch: DLL load failed: The operating system cannot run %1. (pip installation)
body_html:
Issue description

After the installation, torch import fails with an error.
I read the posts on other similar issues and installed intel-openml, mkl, mkl-fft, vs2017 runtime but still getting the same import error. Please note, I am not using anaconda.
P.S. I have also installed Tensorflow which makes use of CUDA and GPU.

Code example

import torch Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 1, in <module> File "C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py", line 78, in <module> from torch._C import * ImportError: DLL load failed: The operating system cannot run %1.

System Info

(https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
The above script doesn't work for me as it imports torch so I have modified the code to ignore torch calls:

`PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: 0.4.0
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0

OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 760M
Nvidia driver version: 385.54
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudnn64_7.dll

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] intel-numpy (1.14.3)
[pip3] numpy (1.14.5)
[pip3] torch (0.4.0)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] Could not collect`

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip3
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • OS: Windows 10
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0
  • Python version: 3.6.5
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0
  • GPU models and configuration: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 760M
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
  • CMake version:
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description
After the installation, torch import fails with an error. 
I read the posts on other similar issues and installed intel-openml, mkl, mkl-fft, vs2017 runtime but still getting the same import error. Please note, I am not using anaconda. 
P.S. I have also installed Tensorflow which makes use of CUDA and GPU.

## Code example
`import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python36\lib\site-packages\torch\__init__.py", line 78, in <module>
    from torch._C import *
ImportError: DLL load failed: The operating system cannot run %1.`

## System Info
(https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
The above script doesn't work for me as it imports torch so I have modified the code to ignore torch calls:

`PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: 0.4.0
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0

OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: Could not collect

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration: GPU 0: GeForce GTX 760M
Nvidia driver version: 385.54
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0\bin\cudnn64_7.dll

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] intel-numpy (1.14.3)
[pip3] numpy (1.14.5)
[pip3] torch (0.4.0)
[pip3] torchvision (0.2.1)
[conda] Could not collect`

- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip3
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- OS: Windows 10
- PyTorch version: 0.4.0
- Python version: 3.6.5
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.0
- GPU models and configuration:  NVIDIA GeForce GTX 760M
- GCC version (if compiling from source):
- CMake version:
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
